Package com.github.antzGames.gdx.ode4j.ode.internal.joints

Class DxJoint

java.lang.Object
com.github.antzGames.gdx.ode4j.ode.internal.DDestructible
com.github.antzGames.gdx.ode4j.ode.internal.DBase
com.github.antzGames.gdx.ode4j.ode.internal.DObject
com.github.antzGames.gdx.ode4j.ode.internal.joints.DxJoint
All Implemented Interfaces:
DJoint
Direct Known Subclasses:
DxJointAMotor, DxJointBall, DxJointContact, DxJointDBall, DxJointFixed, DxJointHinge, DxJointHinge2, DxJointLMotor, DxJointNull, DxJointPiston, DxJointPlane2D, DxJointPR, DxJointSlider, DxJointTransmission, DxJointUniversal
public abstract class DxJoint extends DObject implements DJoint
design note: the general principle for giving a joint the option of connecting to the static environment (i.e. the absolute frame) is to check the second body (joint.node[1].body), and if it is zero then behave as if its body transform is the identity.

  • Field Details

    • dJOINT_REVERSE

      protected static final int dJOINT_REVERSE
      if this flag is set, the joint was attached with arguments (0,body). our convention is to treat all attaches as (body,0), i.e. so node[0].body is always nonzero, so this flag records the fact that the arguments were swapped.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • dJOINT_TWOBODIES

      protected static final int dJOINT_TWOBODIES
      if this flag is set, the joint can not have just one body attached to it, it must have either zero or two bodies attached.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • getInfo2

      public abstract void getInfo2(double worldFPS, double worldERP, Info2Descr info)
      integrator parameters: fps=frames per second (1/stepsize), erp=default error reduction parameter (0..1). (TZ) This method is used solely to extract information required by the stepping algorithms.
      Parameters:
      worldFPS - world FPS
      worldERP - world ERP
      info - info

      public void disable()
      Description copied from interface: DJoint

      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • attach

      public final void attach(DBody body1, DBody body2)
      Description copied from interface: DJoint
      Attach the joint to some new bodies.

      If the joint is already attached, it will be detached from the old bodies first. To attach this joint to only one body, set body1 or body2 to zero - a zero body refers to the static environment. Setting both bodies to zero puts the joint into "limbo", i.e. it will have no effect on the simulation.

      REMARK: Some joints, like hinge-2 need to be attached to two bodies to work.

      Specified by:
      attach in interface DJoint
      Parameters:
      body1 - body 1
      body2 - body 2

    • getBody

      public final DBody getBody(int index)
      Description copied from interface: DJoint
      Return the bodies that this joint connects.

      REMARK: If one of these returned body IDs is zero, the joint connects the other body to the static environment. If both body IDs are zero, the joint is in ``limbo'' and has no effect on the simulation.

      Specified by:
      getBody in interface DJoint
      Parameters:
      index - return the first (0) or second (1) body.
      Returns:
      Body at connection 'index'

    • setFeedback

      public final void setFeedback(DJoint.DJointFeedback fb)
      Description copied from interface: DJoint
      Sets the datastructure that is to receive the feedback.

      The feedback can be used by the user, so that it is known how much force an individual joint exerts.

      Specified by:
      setFeedback in interface DJoint
      Parameters:
      fb - Joint feedback
